Washington GPE 's first ORDINAL public office , from 1749 to 1750 DATE , was as surveyor of Culpeper County GPE in the Colony of Virginia GPE . He subsequently received military training and was assigned command of the Virginia Regiment ORG during the French NORP and Indian War EVENT . He was later elected to the Virginia House of Burgesses ORG and was named a delegate to the Continental Congress ORG in Philadelphia GPE , which appointed him Commander - in - Chief of the Continental Army ORG . Washington GPE led American NORP forces to a decisive victory over the British NORP in the Revolutionary War EVENT , leading the British NORP to sign the Treaty of Paris WORK_OF_ART , which acknowledged the sovereignty and independence of the United States GPE . He resigned his commission in 1783 DATE after the conclusion of the Revolutionary War EVENT .
Washington GPE played an indispensable role in adopting and ratifying the Constitution LAW , which replaced the Articles of Confederation ORG in 1789 DATE . He was then twice elected president by the Electoral College ORG unanimously . As the first ORDINAL U.S. GPE president , Washington GPE implemented a strong , well - financed national government while remaining impartial in a fierce rivalry that emerged between cabinet members [REDACTED] [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] . During the French Revolution EVENT , he proclaimed a policy of neutrality while sanctioning the Jay Treaty LAW . He set enduring precedents for the office of president , including use of the title " Mr. President " and the two CARDINAL - term tradition . His 1796 DATE farewell address became a preeminent statement on republicanism in which he wrote about the importance of national unity and the dangers regionalism , partisanship , and foreign influence pose to it .
Washington GPE has been memorialized by monuments , a federal holiday DATE , various media depictions , geographical locations including the national capital , the State of Washington ORG , stamps , and currency . He is ranked among the greatest U.S. GPE presidents . In 1976 DATE , Washington GPE was posthumously promoted to the rank of General of the Armies , the highest rank in the U.S. Army ORG . His legacy is marred , however , by his ownership of slaves and his complicated relationship with slavery , as well as his policy to assimilate Native Americans NORP into the Anglo NORP - American culture and waging war against Native American NORP nations during the Revolutionary Wars EVENT and the Northwest Indian War EVENT .
[REDACTED] [REDACTED] was born on February 22 DATE , 1732,[a ] at Popes Creek FAC in Westmoreland County GPE , Virginia.[3 ] He was the first ORDINAL of six CARDINAL children of [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] ] His father was a justice of the peace and a prominent public figure who had four CARDINAL additional children from his first ORDINAL marriage to [REDACTED] [REDACTED] ] The family moved to Little Hunting Creek WORK_OF_ART in 1734 DATE before eventually settling in Ferry Farm ORG near Fredericksburg GPE , Virginia GPE . When [REDACTED] died in 1743 DATE , Washington GPE inherited Ferry Farm PRODUCT and ten CARDINAL slaves ; his older half CARDINAL - brother [REDACTED] inherited [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] and renamed it Mount Vernon.[6][7 LOC ]
Washington GPE did not have the formal education his elder brothers received at Appleby Grammar School ORG in England GPE , but he did attend the Lower Church School ORG in Hartfield GPE . He learned mathematics , trigonometry , and land surveying , and became a talented draftsman and mapmaker . By early adulthood , he was writing with " considerable force " and " precision".[8 ] As a teenager , to practice his penmanship , Washington GPE compiled over a hundred rules for social interaction styled Rules of Civility and Decent Behaviour ORG in Company and Conversation , copied from an English LANGUAGE translation of a French NORP book of manners.[9 ]
Washington GPE often visited Mount Vernon GPE and Belvoir GPE , the plantation of [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , [REDACTED] 's father - in - law . Fairfax GPE became Washington GPE 's patron and surrogate father , and Washington GPE spent a month DATE in 1748 DATE with a team surveying Fairfax GPE 's Shenandoah Valley LOC property.[10 ] The following year DATE , he received a surveyor 's license from the College of William & Mary.[b ORG ] Even though Washington GPE had not served the customary apprenticeship , Fairfax GPE appointed him surveyor of Culpeper County GPE , Virginia GPE , where he took his oath of office July 20 , 1749 DATE . He subsequently familiarized himself with the frontier region , and though he resigned from the job in 1750 DATE , he continued to do surveys west of the Blue Ridge ORG Mountains.[11 ] By 1752 DATE , he had bought almost 1,500 acres QUANTITY ( 600 CARDINAL ha ) in the Valley LOC and owned 2,315 acres QUANTITY ( 937 CARDINAL ha).[12 ]
In 1751 DATE , Washington GPE made his only trip abroad when he accompanied [REDACTED] to Barbados GPE , hoping the climate would cure his brother 's tuberculosis.[13 ] Washington GPE contracted smallpox during that trip , which left his face slightly scarred.[14 ] [REDACTED] died in 1752 DATE , and Washington GPE leased Mount Vernon LOC from his widow [REDACTED] ; he inherited it outright after her death in 1761.[15 CARDINAL ]
[REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] service as adjutant general of the Virginia GPE militia inspired [REDACTED] to seek a commission . Virginia GPE 's lieutenant governor , [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , appointed Washington GPE as a major and commander of one CARDINAL of the four CARDINAL militia districts . The British NORP and French NORP were competing for control of the Ohio Valley LOC : the British NORP were constructing forts along the Ohio River LOC , and the French NORP between the Ohio River LOC and Lake Erie.[16 GPE ]
In October 1753 DATE , Dinwiddie ORG appointed Washington GPE as a special envoy . He had sent Washington GPE to demand French NORP forces to vacate land that was claimed by the British NORP . Washington GPE was also appointed to make peace with the Iroquois Confederacy ORG , and to gather further intelligence about the French NORP forces.[17 ] Washington GPE met with Half - King Tanacharison ORG , and other Iroquois NORP chiefs , at Logstown ORG , and gathered information about the numbers and locations of the French NORP forts , as well as intelligence concerning individuals taken prisoner by the French NORP . Washington GPE was nicknamed Conotocaurius ORG by Tanacharison ORG . The name , meaning " devourer of villages " , had been given to his great - grandfather [REDACTED] [REDACTED] in the late 17th century DATE by the Susquehannock.[18 ]
Washington GPE 's party reached the Ohio River ORG in November 1753 DATE , and was intercepted by a French NORP patrol . The party was escorted to Fort Le Boeuf FAC , where Washington GPE was received in a friendly manner . He delivered the British NORP demand to vacate to the French NORP commander [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , but the French NORP refused to leave . [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] gave Washington GPE his official answer after a few days ' DATE delay , as well as food and winter DATE clothing for his party 's journey back to Virginia.[19 ] Washington GPE completed the precarious mission in 77 days DATE , in difficult winter DATE conditions , achieving a measure of distinction when his report was published in Virginia GPE and London.[20 ]
In February 1754 DATE , Dinwiddie ORG promoted Washington GPE to lieutenant colonel and second ORDINAL - in - command of the 300 CARDINAL - strong Virginia Regiment ORG , with orders to confront French NORP forces at the Forks LOC of the Ohio.[21 ] Washington GPE set out with half CARDINAL the regiment in April DATE and soon learned a French NORP force of 1,000 CARDINAL had begun construction of Fort Duquesne LOC there . In May DATE , having set up a defensive position at Great Meadows ORG , he learned that the French NORP had made camp seven miles QUANTITY ( 11 km QUANTITY ) away ; he decided to take the offensive.[22 ]
The French NORP detachment proved to be only about 50 CARDINAL men , so Washington GPE advanced on May 28 DATE with a small force of Virginians NORP and Indian NORP allies to ambush them.[c][24 ] During the ambush , French NORP forces were killed outright with muskets and hatchets , including French NORP commander [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , who had been carrying a diplomatic message for the British NORP . The French NORP later found their countrymen dead and scalped and blamed Washington GPE , who had retreated to Fort GPE Necessity.[25 ]
The full Virginia Regiment ORG joined Washington GPE at Fort Necessity FAC the following month DATE with news that he had been promoted to command of the regiment and colonel upon the regimental commander 's death . The regiment was reinforced by an independent company of a hundred CARDINAL South Carolinians NORP led by Captain [REDACTED] [REDACTED] ; his royal commission outranked Washington GPE 's and a conflict of command ensued . On July 3 DATE , a French NORP force attacked with 900 men , and the ensuing battle ended in Washington GPE 's surrender.[26 ] He signed a surrender document in which he unwittingly took responsibility for " assassinating " Jumonville GPE , later blaming the translator for not properly translating it.[27 ]
In the aftermath , Colonel [REDACTED] [REDACTED] took command of intercolonial forces , the Virginia Regiment ORG was divided , and Washington GPE was offered a captaincy in one CARDINAL of the newly formed regiments . He refused , however , as it would have been a demotion and instead resigned his commission.[28 ] The " Jumonville affair " became the incident which ignited the French NORP and Indian War EVENT , later to become part of the Seven Years ' DATE War.[29][30 ]
In 1755 DATE , Washington GPE served voluntarily as an aide to General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , who led a British NORP expedition to expel the French NORP from Fort Duquesne LOC and the Ohio GPE Country.[31 ] On Washington GPE 's recommendation , [REDACTED] split the army into one main column and a lightly equipped " flying column".[32 ] Suffering from severe dysentery , Washington GPE was left behind , and when he rejoined [REDACTED] at Monongahela GPE the French NORP and their Indian NORP allies ambushed the divided army . Two - thirds CARDINAL of the British NORP force became casualties , including the mortally wounded Braddock ORG . Under the command of Lieutenant Colonel [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , Washington GPE , still very ill , rallied the survivors and formed a rear guard , allowing the remnants of the force to disengage and retreat.[33 ]
During the engagement , he had two CARDINAL horses shot from under him , and his hat and coat were bullet - pierced.[34 ] His conduct under fire redeemed his reputation among critics of his command in the Battle of Fort Necessity,[35 LOC ] but he was not included by the succeeding commander ( Colonel [REDACTED] [REDACTED] ) in planning subsequent operations.[36 ]
The Virginia Regiment ORG was reconstituted in August 1755 DATE , and Dinwiddie ORG appointed Washington GPE its commander , again with the rank of colonel . Washington GPE clashed over seniority almost immediately , this time with [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , another captain of superior royal rank , who commanded a detachment of Marylanders PRODUCT at the regiment 's headquarters in Fort Cumberland.[37 GPE ] Washington GPE , impatient for an offensive against Fort Duquesne FAC , was convinced Braddock ORG would have granted him a royal commission and pressed his case in February 1756 DATE with Braddock ORG 's successor as Commander - in - Chief , [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , and again in January 1757 DATE with [REDACTED] 's successor , Lord Loudoun GPE . [REDACTED] ruled in Washington GPE 's favor only in the matter of Dagworthy GPE ; Loudoun GPE humiliated Washington GPE , refused him a royal commission and agreed only to relieve him of the responsibility of manning Fort Cumberland.[38 ] FAC In 1758 DATE , the Virginia Regiment ORG was assigned to the British NORP Forbes Expedition ORG to capture Fort Duquesne.[d][40 GPE ] Washington GPE disagreed with General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] ' tactics and chosen route.[41 ] Forbes nevertheless made Washington GPE a brevet brigadier general and gave him command of one CARDINAL of the three CARDINAL brigades that would assault the fort . The French NORP had abandoned the fort and the valley before the assault , however , and Washington GPE only saw a friendly fire incident which left 14 CARDINAL dead and 26 CARDINAL injured . Frustrated , he resigned his commission soon afterwards and returned to Mount Vernon.[42 ] LOC Under Washington GPE , the Virginia Regiment ORG had defended 300 miles QUANTITY ( 480 km QUANTITY ) of frontier against twenty CARDINAL Indian NORP attacks in ten CARDINAL months.[43 ] He increased the professionalism of the regiment as it grew from 300 CARDINAL to 1,000 CARDINAL men , and Virginia GPE 's frontier population suffered less than other colonies . Though he failed to realize a royal commission , he gained self - confidence , leadership skills , and knowledge of British NORP military tactics . The destructive competition Washington GPE witnessed among colonial politicians fostered his later support of a strong central government.[44 ]
On January 6 , 1759 DATE , Washington GPE , at age 26 DATE , married [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , the 27 - year - old DATE widow of wealthy plantation owner Daniel Parke Custis ORG . The marriage took place at [REDACTED] 's estate ; she was intelligent , gracious , and experienced in managing a planter 's estate , and the couple had a happy marriage.[45 ] They moved to Mount Vernon GPE , near Alexandria GPE , where he lived as a planter of tobacco and wheat and emerged as a political figure.[46 ]
Washington GPE 's 1751 DATE bout with smallpox is thought to have rendered him sterile , though it is equally likely that " [REDACTED] may have sustained injury during the birth of [REDACTED] , her final child , making additional births impossible . "[ 47 CARDINAL ] The couple lamented not having any children together.[e][50 ] Despite this , the two CARDINAL raised [REDACTED] 's two CARDINAL children John Parke Custis ORG ( [REDACTED] ) and Martha Parke Custis ORG ( [REDACTED] ) , and later [REDACTED] 's two CARDINAL youngest children Eleanor Parke Custis ORG ( Nelly ) and George Washington Parke Custis ORG ( [REDACTED] ) , along with numerous nieces and nephews.[51 ]
The marriage gave Washington GPE control over [REDACTED] 's one - third CARDINAL dower interest in the 18,000 - acre QUANTITY ( 7,300 CARDINAL ha ) Custis estate , and he managed the remaining two - thirds CARDINAL for [REDACTED] 's children ; the estate also included 84 CARDINAL slaves . As a result , he became one of the wealthiest men in Virginia GPE , which increased his social standing.[52 ]
At Washington GPE 's urging , Governor Lord Botetourt fulfilled Dinwiddie ORG 's 1754 DATE promise of land bounties to all - volunteer militia during the French NORP and Indian NORP War.[53 ] In late 1770 DATE , Washington GPE inspected the lands in the Ohio GPE and Great Kanawha ORG regions , and he engaged surveyor [REDACTED] [REDACTED] to subdivide it . Crawford ORG allotted 23,200 acres QUANTITY ( 9,400 CARDINAL ha ) to Washington GPE ; Washington GPE told the veterans that their land was hilly and unsuitable for farming , and he agreed to purchase 20,147 acres QUANTITY ( 8,153 CARDINAL ha ) , leaving some feeling they had been duped.[54 ] He also doubled the size of Mount Vernon GPE to 6,500 acres QUANTITY ( 2,600 CARDINAL ha ) and , by 1775 DATE , had increased its slave population by more than a hundred.[55 ]
As a respected military hero and large landowner , Washington GPE held local offices and was elected to the Virginia GPE provincial legislature , representing Frederick County GPE in the House of Burgesses ORG for seven years DATE beginning in 1758.[55 ] He first ORDINAL ran for the seat in 1755 DATE but was soundly beaten by [REDACTED] West.[56][57 ] When he ran in 1758 DATE , Washington GPE plied voters with beer , brandy , and other beverages . Despite being away serving on the Forbes Expedition ORG , he won the election with roughly 40 percent PERCENT of the vote , defeating three CARDINAL opponents with the help of local supporters.[58][59 ]
Early in his legislative career , Washington GPE rarely spoke or even attended legislative sessions . He would later become a prominent critic of Britain GPE 's taxation policy and mercantilist policies towards the American NORP colonies and became more politically active starting in the 1760s.[60 ]
Washington GPE imported luxuries and other goods from England GPE , paying for them by exporting tobacco . His profligate spending combined with low tobacco prices left him 1,800 MONEY in debt by 1764 DATE , prompting him to diversify his holdings.[61 ] In 1765 DATE , because of erosion and other soil problems , he changed [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] primary cash crop from tobacco to wheat and expanded operations to include corn flour milling and fishing.[62][63 ]
Washington GPE soon was counted among the political and social elite in Virginia GPE . From 1768 to 1775 DATE , he invited some 2,000 CARDINAL guests to Mount Vernon GPE , mostly those whom he considered people of rank , and was known to be exceptionally cordial toward guests.[64 ] Washington GPE also took time for leisure with fox hunting , fishing , dances , theater , cards , backgammon , and billiards.[65 ]
Washington GPE 's stepdaughter [REDACTED] suffered from epileptic attacks from age 12 DATE , and she died in his arms in 1773 DATE . The following day , he wrote to [REDACTED] [REDACTED] : " It is easier to conceive , than to describe , the distress of this Family".[66 ] He canceled all business activity and remained with [REDACTED] every night for three CARDINAL months.[67 ]
Washington GPE played a central role before and during the American Revolution EVENT . His distrust of the British NORP military had begun when he was passed over for promotion into the Regular Army ORG . Opposed to taxes imposed by the British Parliament ORG on the Colonies GPE without proper representation,[68 ] he and other colonists were also angered by the Royal Proclamation of 1763 ORG which banned American NORP settlement west of the Allegheny Mountains LOC and protected the British NORP fur trade.[69 ]
Washington GPE believed the Stamp Act 1765 LAW was an " Act of Oppression " and celebrated its repeal the following year.[f ] In March 1766 DATE , Parliament ORG passed the Declaratory Act LAW asserting that Parliamentary law superseded colonial law.[71 ] In the late 1760s DATE , the interference of the British Crown ORG in American NORP lucrative western land speculation spurred the American NORP Revolution.[72 ] Washington GPE was a prosperous land speculator , and in 1767 DATE , he encouraged " adventures " to acquire backcountry western lands.[72 ORG ] Washington GPE helped lead widespread protests against the Townshend ORG Acts passed by Parliament ORG in 1767 DATE , and he introduced a proposal in May 1769 DATE which urged Virginians NORP to boycott British NORP goods ; the Acts were mostly repealed in 1770.[73 CARDINAL ]
Parliament ORG sought to punish Massachusetts GPE colonists for their role in the Boston Tea Party ORG in 1774 DATE by passing the Coercive Acts FAC , which Washington GPE saw as " an invasion of our rights and privileges".[74 ] He said Americans NORP must not submit to acts of tyranny since " custom and use shall make us as tame and abject slaves , as the blacks we rule over with such arbitrary sway".[75 ] That July DATE , he and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] drafted a list of resolutions for the Fairfax County GPE committee , including a call to end the Atlantic LOC slave trade , which were adopted.[76 ]
On August 1 DATE , Washington GPE attended the First Virginia Convention ORG . There , he was selected as a delegate to the First ORDINAL Continental Congress.[77 ] As tensions rose in 1774 DATE , he helped train militias in Virginia GPE and organized enforcement of the Continental Association ORG boycott of British NORP goods instituted by the Congress.[78 ]
The American Revolutionary War broke out on April 19 , 1775 DATE , with the Battles of Lexington GPE and Concord GPE and the Siege of Boston.[79 GPE ] Upon hearing the news , Washington GPE was " sobered and dismayed",[80 ] and he hastily departed Mount Vernon LOC on May 4 , 1775 DATE , to join the Second Continental Congress ORG in Philadelphia.[81 ]
On June 14 , 1775 DATE , Congress ORG created the Continental Army ORG and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] nominated Washington GPE as its commander - in - chief , mainly because of his military experience and the belief that a Virginian GPE would better unite the colonies . He was unanimously elected by Congress ORG the next day.[82 DATE ] Washington GPE appeared before Congress ORG in uniform and gave an acceptance speech on June 16 DATE , declining a salary , though he was later reimbursed expenses.[83 ]
Washington GPE was commissioned on June 19 DATE and officially appointed by Congress ORG as " General & Commander ORG in chief of the army of the United Colonies ORG and of all the forces raised or to be raised by them".[84 ] He was instructed to take charge of the Siege of Boston ORG on June 22 DATE , 1775.[85 ]
Congress ORG chose his primary staff officers , including Major General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , Adjutant General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , Major General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , Major General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , and Major General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] . [ 86 CARDINAL ] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , a young bookkeeper , impressed Adams ORG and Washington GPE with ordnance knowledge and was subsequently promoted to colonel and chief of artillery . Similarly , Washington GPE was impressed by [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] intelligence and bravery . He would later promote him to colonel and appoint him his aide - de - camp.[87 ]
Washington GPE initially banned the enlistment of blacks , both free and enslaved , into the Continental Army ORG . The British NORP saw an opportunity to divide the colonies , and the colonial governor of Virginia GPE issued a proclamation , which promised freedom to slaves if they joined the British.[88 ] Desperate for manpower by late 1777 DATE , Washington GPE relented and overturned his ban.[89 ] By the end of the war DATE , around one - tenth CARDINAL of Washington GPE 's army were blacks.[90 ] Following the British NORP surrender , Washington GPE sought to enforce terms of the preliminary Treaty of Paris GPE ( 1783 DATE ) by reclaiming slaves freed by the British NORP and returning them to servitude . He arranged to make this request to Sir [REDACTED] [REDACTED] on May 6 , 1783 DATE . Instead , [REDACTED] issued 3,000 CARDINAL freedom certificates and all former slaves in New York City GPE were able to leave before the city was evacuated by the British NORP in late November 1783.[91 ]
Early in 1775 DATE , in response to the growing rebellious movement , London GPE sent British NORP troops to occupy Boston GPE , led by General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , commander of British NORP forces in America.[92 ] They set up fortifications , making the city impervious to attack . Local militias surrounded the city and effectively trapped the British NORP troops , resulting in a standoff.[93 ]
As Washington GPE headed for Boston GPE , word of his march preceded him , and he was greeted everywhere ; gradually , he became a symbol of the Patriot cause.[94 ] ORG Upon arrival on July 2 , 1775 DATE , two weeks DATE after the Battle of Bunker Hill LOC , he set up headquarters in Cambridge GPE . When he went to inspect the army , he found undisciplined militia.[95 ] After consultation , he initiated [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] suggested reforms : drilling the soldiers and imposing strict discipline.[96 ] Washington GPE ordered his officers to identify the skills of recruits to ensure military effectiveness , while removing incompetent officers.[97 ] He petitioned Gage , his former superior , to release captured Patriot ORG officers from prison and treat them humanely.[98 ] In October 1775 DATE , King [REDACTED] [REDACTED] declared that the colonies were in open rebellion and relieved Gage of command for incompetence , replacing him with General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] ]
The Continental Army ORG , reduced to only 9,600 CARDINAL men by January 1776 DATE due to expiring short - term enlistments , had to be supplemented with militia . Soon , they were joined by Knox ORG with heavy artillery captured from Fort GPE Ticonderoga.[100 ] When the Charles River LOC froze over , Washington GPE was eager to cross and storm Boston GPE , but General [REDACTED] and others were opposed to untrained militia striking well - garrisoned fortifications . Instead , he agreed to secure the Dorchester Heights LOC , 100 feet QUANTITY above Boston GPE , with Knox ORG 's artillery to try to force the British NORP out.[101 ]
On March 9 DATE , under cover of darkness , Washington GPE 's troops bombarded British NORP ships in Boston GPE harbor . On March 17 DATE , 9,000 CARDINAL British NORP troops and Loyalists ORG began a chaotic ten - day DATE evacuation aboard 120 CARDINAL ships . Soon after , Washington GPE entered the city with 500 CARDINAL men , with explicit orders not to plunder the city.[102 ] He refrained from exerting military authority in Boston GPE , leaving civilian matters in the hands of local authorities.[g][104 ]
After the victory at Boston GPE , Washington GPE correctly guessed that the British NORP would return to New York City GPE , a Loyalist ORG stronghold , and retaliate . He arrived there on April 13 , 1776 DATE , and ordered the construction of fortifications to thwart the expected British NORP attack . He also ordered his occupying forces to treat civilians and their property with respect , to avoid the abuses Bostonians NORP suffered at the hands of British NORP troops.[105 ]
Howe transported his resupplied army , with the British NORP fleet , from Halifax ORG to New York City GPE . [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , who ran the British NORP war effort in England GPE , believed it could be won with one " decisive blow".[106 ] The British NORP forces , including more than a hundred CARDINAL ships and thousands CARDINAL of troops , began arriving on Staten Island LOC on July 2 DATE to lay siege to the city.[107 ] After the Declaration of Independence WORK_OF_ART was unanimously adopted on July 4 DATE , Washington GPE informed his troops on July 9 DATE that Congress ORG had declared the united colonies to be " free and independent states".[108 ]
Howe 's troop strength totaled 32,000 CARDINAL regulars and Hessian NORP auxiliaries , and Washington GPE 's consisted of 23,000 CARDINAL , mostly raw recruits and militia.[109 ] In August DATE , Howe ORG landed 20,000 CARDINAL troops at Gravesend GPE , Brooklyn GPE , and approached Washington GPE 's fortifications Opposing his generals , Washington GPE chose to fight , based on inaccurate information that Howe ORG 's army had only 8,000 - plus CARDINAL troops.[110 ] In the Battle of Long Island LOC , Howe assaulted Washington GPE 's flank and inflicted 1,500 CARDINAL Patriot casualties , the British NORP suffering 400.[111 CARDINAL ] Washington GPE retreated , instructing General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] to acquire river craft . On August 30 DATE , General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] held off the British NORP and gave cover while the army crossed the East River LOC under darkness to Manhattan GPE without loss of life or materiel , although Alexander ORG was captured.[112 ]
[REDACTED] was emboldened by his Long Island LOC victory and dispatched Washington GPE as " [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , Esq GPE . " in futility to negotiate peace . Washington ORG declined , demanding to be addressed with diplomatic protocol , as general and fellow belligerent , not as a " rebel " , lest his men be hanged as such if captured.[113 ] The Royal Navy ORG bombarded the unstable earthworks on lower Manhattan GPE Island.[114 ] Despite misgivings , Washington GPE heeded the advice of Generals Greene FAC and Putnam ORG to defend Fort Washington FAC . They were unable to hold it ; Washington GPE abandoned the fort and ordered his army north to the White Plains.[115 ] FAC [REDACTED] 's pursuit forced Washington GPE to retreat across the Hudson River LOC to Fort Lee GPE to avoid encirclement . Howe landed his troops on Manhattan GPE in November DATE and captured Fort Washington FAC , inflicting high casualties on the Americans NORP . Washington GPE was responsible for delaying the retreat , though he blamed Congress ORG and General [REDACTED] . Loyalists in New York City GPE considered Howe a liberator and spread a rumor that Washington GPE had set fire to the city.[116 ] Patriot morale reached its lowest when [REDACTED] was captured.[117 ] Now reduced to 5,400 CARDINAL troops , Washington GPE 's army retreated through New Jersey GPE , and [REDACTED] broke off pursuit to set up winter quarters DATE in New York.[118 GPE ]
Washington GPE crossed the Delaware River LOC into Pennsylvania GPE , where [REDACTED] 's replacement General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] joined him with 2,000 CARDINAL more troops.[119 ] The future of the Continental Army ORG was in doubt due to lack of supplies , a harsh winter DATE , expiring enlistments , and desertions . Washington GPE was disappointed that many New Jersey GPE residents were Loyalists ORG or skeptical about independence.[120 ]
Howe split up his army and posted a Hessian NORP garrison at Trenton GPE to hold western New Jersey GPE and the east shore of the Delaware.[121 ] Desperate for a victory , Washington GPE and his generals devised a surprise attack on Trenton GPE . The army was to cross the Delaware FAC in three CARDINAL divisions : one led by Washington GPE ( 2,400 CARDINAL troops ) , another by General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] ( 700 CARDINAL ) , and the third ORDINAL by Colonel [REDACTED] [REDACTED] ( 1,500 CARDINAL ) . The force was to then split , with Washington GPE taking the Pennington Road and ORG General [REDACTED] traveling south on the river 's edge.[122 ]
Washington ordered a 60 - mile QUANTITY search for Durham GPE boats to transport his army , and the destruction of vessels that could be used by the British.[123 ] He personally risked capture while staking out the Jersey GPE shoreline alone leading up to the crossing . Washington GPE crossed the Delaware GPE on Christmas night TIME , 1776.[124 CARDINAL ] His men followed across the ice - obstructed river from McConkey ORG 's Ferry PRODUCT , with 40 CARDINAL men per vessel . The wind churned up the waters , and they were pelted with hail , but by 3:00 a.m. TIME on December 26 DATE , they made it across with no losses.[125 ] [REDACTED] was delayed , managing frightened horses and about 18 CARDINAL field guns on flat - bottomed ferries . Cadwalader and Ewing failed to cross due to the ice and heavy currents . [REDACTED] [REDACTED] arrived , Washington GPE proceeded to Trenton GPE , rather than risk being spotted returning his army to Pennsylvania.[126 ]
The troops spotted Hessian NORP positions a mile QUANTITY from Trenton GPE , so Washington GPE split his force into two CARDINAL columns , rallying his men : " Soldiers keep by your officers . For God 's sake , keep by your officers . " The two CARDINAL columns were separated at the Birmingham GPE crossroads . General [REDACTED] 's column took the upper Ferry Road WORK_OF_ART , led by Washington GPE , and General [REDACTED] 's column advanced on River Road.[127 FAC ] The Americans NORP marched in sleet and snowfall . Many were shoeless with bloodied feet , and two CARDINAL died of exposure . At sunrise , Washington GPE , aided by Colonel [REDACTED] and artillery , led his men in a surprise attack on the unsuspecting Hessians NORP and their commander , Colonel [REDACTED] [REDACTED] . The Hessians NORP had 22 CARDINAL killed , including Colonel [REDACTED] , 83 CARDINAL wounded , and 850 CARDINAL captured with supplies.[128 ]
Washington GPE retreated across the Delaware GPE to Pennsylvania GPE and returned to New Jersey GPE on January 3 , 1777 DATE , launching an attack on British NORP regulars at Princeton GPE , with 40 CARDINAL Americans NORP killed or wounded and 273 CARDINAL British NORP killed or captured.[129 ] American Generals Hugh Mercer and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] were being driven back by the British NORP when [REDACTED] was mortally wounded . Washington GPE arrived and led the men in a counterattack which advanced to within 30 yards QUANTITY ( 27 CARDINAL m ) of the British NORP line.[130 ]
Some British NORP troops retreated after a brief stand , while others took refuge in Nassau Hall GPE , which became the target of Colonel [REDACTED] [REDACTED] 's cannons . Washington GPE 's troops charged , the British NORP surrendered in less than an hour TIME , and 194 CARDINAL soldiers laid down their arms.[131 ] Howe retreated to New York City GPE where his army remained inactive until early the next [REDACTED] ] Washington GPE took up winter DATE headquarters in [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] Tavern in Morristown GPE , New Jersey,[133 ] while he received munition from the Hibernia mines.[134 ] While in Morristown GPE , Washington GPE 's troops disrupted British NORP supply lines and expelled them from parts of New Jersey.[135 ]
During his stay in Morristown GPE , Washington GPE ordered the inoculation of Continental ORG troops against smallpox . This went against the wishes of the Continental Congress ORG who had issued a proclamation prohibiting it , but Washington GPE feared the spread of smallpox in the army . The mass inoculation proved successful , with only isolated infections occurring and no regiments incapacitated by the disease.[136 ]
The British NORP still controlled New York GPE , and many Patriot ORG soldiers did not re - enlist or deserted after the harsh winter DATE campaign . Congress ORG instituted greater rewards for re - enlisting and punishments for desertion to effect greater troop numbers.[137 ] Strategically , Washington GPE 's victories at Trenton GPE and [REDACTED] were pivotal ; they revived [REDACTED] morale and quashed the British NORP strategy of showing overwhelming force followed by offering generous terms , changing the course of the war.[138][124 ] In February 1777 DATE , word of the American NORP victories reached London GPE , and the British NORP realized the Patriots ORG were in a position to demand unconditional independence.[139 ]
In July 1777 DATE , British NORP General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] led the Saratoga NORP campaign south from Quebec GPE through Lake Champlain LOC and recaptured Fort Ticonderoga ORG intending to divide New England LOC , including control of the Hudson River LOC . However , General [REDACTED] in British NORP - occupied New York City GPE blundered , taking his army south to Philadelphia GPE rather than up the Hudson River LOC to join [REDACTED] near Albany.[140 ]
Washington GPE and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] rushed to Philadelphia GPE to engage Howe . In the Battle of Brandywine LOC , on September 11 , 1777 DATE , [REDACTED] outmaneuvered Washington GPE and marched unopposed into the nation 's capital at Philadelphia GPE . A Patriot ORG attack failed against the British NORP at Germantown GPE in October.[141 ]
In Upstate New York , the Patriots ORG were led by General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] . Concerned about Burgoyne ORG 's movements southward , Washington GPE sent reinforcements north with Generals ORG [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , his most aggressive field commander , and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] . On October 7 , 1777 DATE , [REDACTED] tried to take Bemis Heights GPE but was isolated from support by [REDACTED] . He was forced to retreat to Saratoga NORP and ultimately surrendered after the Battles of Saratoga NORP . As Washington GPE suspected , Gates ORG ' victory emboldened his critics.[142 ]
Biographer [REDACTED] [REDACTED] maintains , " It was inevitable that the defeats of Washington GPE 's forces and the concurrent victory of the forces in upper New York GPE should be compared . " Admiration for Washington GPE was waning , including little credit from [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] Washington GPE and his Continental Army ORG of 11,000 CARDINAL men went into winter quarters DATE at Valley Forge LOC north of Philadelphia GPE in December 1777 DATE . There they lost between 2,000 and 3,000 CARDINAL men as a result of disease and lack of food , clothing , and shelter.[145 ] The British NORP were comfortably quartered in Philadelphia GPE , paying for supplies in pounds sterling , while Washington GPE struggled with a devalued American NORP paper currency . The woodlands were soon exhausted of game . By February DATE , Washington GPE was facing lowered morale and increased desertions among his troops.[146 ]
An internal revolt by his officers , led by Major General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , prompted some members of Congress ORG to consider removing Washington GPE from command . Washington GPE 's supporters resisted , and the matter was dropped after much [REDACTED] [REDACTED] Once the plot was exposed , Conway ORG wrote an apology to Washington GPE , resigned , and returned to France.[148 ]
Washington GPE made repeated petitions to Congress ORG for provisions . He received a congressional delegation to check the Army ORG 's conditions and expressed the urgency of the situation , proclaiming : " Something must be done . Important alterations must be made . " He recommended that Congress ORG expedite supplies , and Congress ORG agreed to strengthen and fund the army 's supply lines by reorganizing the commissary department . By late February DATE , supplies began arriving.[103 ] Meanwhile , Baron PERSON [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] incessant drilling transformed Washington GPE 's recruits into a disciplined fighting force by the end of winter DATE camp.[149 ] For his services , Washington GPE promoted [REDACTED] [REDACTED] to Major General and made him chief of staff.[150][151 ]
In early 1778 DATE , the French NORP responded to Burgoyne ORG 's defeat and entered into a Treaty of Alliance with the Americans NORP . Congress ORG ratified the treaty in May DATE , which amounted to a French NORP declaration of war against Britain.[152 ] In May 1778 DATE , [REDACTED] resigned and was replaced by Sir [REDACTED] Clinton.[153 ]
The British NORP evacuated Philadelphia GPE for New York GPE that June and Washington GPE summoned a war council of American NORP and French NORP generals . He chose a partial attack on the retreating British NORP at the Battle of Monmouth LOC . Generals [REDACTED] [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] moved with 4,000 CARDINAL men , without Washington GPE 's knowledge , and bungled their first ORDINAL attack on June 28 DATE . Washington GPE relieved [REDACTED] and achieved a draw after an expansive battle . At nightfall , the British NORP continued their retreat to New York GPE , and Washington GPE moved his army outside the city.[154 ] Monmouth GPE was Washington GPE 's last battle in the North.[155 ]
Washington GPE became America GPE 's first ORDINAL spymaster by designing an espionage system against the British.[156 ] In 1778 DATE , Major [REDACTED] [REDACTED] formed the Culper Ring ORG at Washington GPE 's direction to covertly collect information about the British NORP in New York.[157 ] Washington GPE had disregarded incidents of disloyalty by [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , who had distinguished himself in many battles.[158 ]
In 1780 DATE , [REDACTED] began supplying British NORP spymaster [REDACTED] Andre with sensitive information intended to compromise Washington GPE and capture West Point LOC , a key American NORP defensive position on the [REDACTED] River.[159 ] Historians [REDACTED] [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] noted possible reasons for [REDACTED] 's defection to be his anger at losing promotions to junior officers , or repeated slights from Congress ORG . He was also deeply in debt , profiteering from the war , and disappointed by Washington GPE 's lack of support during his eventual court - martial.[160 ]
After repeated requests , Washington GPE agreed to give [REDACTED] command of West Point LOC in August.[161 ] On September 21 DATE , [REDACTED] met Andre and gave him plans to take over the garrison.[162 ] While returning to British NORP lines , Andre was captured by militia who discovered the plans ; upon hearing the news of Andre PRODUCT 's capture on September 24 DATE , while waiting to greet and have breakfast with Washington GPE , [REDACTED] immediately fleed to the HMS Vulture WORK_OF_ART , the ship that had brought Andre to West Point GPE , and escaped to New York.[163 ]
Upon being told about [REDACTED] 's treason , Washington GPE recalled the commanders positioned under [REDACTED] at key points around the fort to prevent any complicity . He assumed personal command at West Point LOC and reorganized its defenses.[164 ] Andre 's trial for espionage ended in a death sentence , and Washington GPE offered to return him to the British NORP in exchange for [REDACTED] , but [REDACTED] refused . Andre was hanged on October 2 , 1780 DATE , despite his request for a firing squad , to deter other spies.[165 ]
In late 1778 DATE , General [REDACTED] shipped 3,000 CARDINAL troops from New York GPE to Georgia GPE and launched a Southern NORP invasion against Savannah GPE , reinforced by 2,000 CARDINAL British NORP and Loyalist ORG troops . They repelled an attack by American NORP patriots and French NORP naval forces , which bolstered the British NORP war effort.[166 ]
In June 1778 DATE , Iroquois NORP warriors joined with Loyalist ORG rangers led by [REDACTED] [REDACTED] and killed more than 200 CARDINAL frontiersmen , laying waste to the Wyoming Valley LOC in Northeastern Pennsylvania.[167 ] In mid-1779 DATE , in response to this and other attacks on New England LOC towns , Washington GPE ordered General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] to lead an expedition to force the Iroquois NORP out of New York GPE by effecting " the total destruction and devastation " of their villages and taking their women and children hostage.[168][169 ] The expedition systematically destroyed Iroquois NORP villages and food stocks , and forced at least 5,036 CARDINAL Iroquois NORP to flee to British Canada ORG . The campaign directly killed a few hundred CARDINAL Iroquois GPE , but according to historian [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , the net effect was to reduce the Iroquois NORP by half CARDINAL . They became unable to survive the harsh winter of 17791780 DATE ; some historians now described the campaign as a genocide.[170 ]
Washington GPE 's troops went into quarters at Morristown GPE , New Jersey GPE for their worst winter DATE of the war , with temperatures well below freezing . New York Harbor LOC was frozen , snow covered the ground for weeks DATE , and the troops again lacked provisions.[171 ]
In January 1780 DATE , [REDACTED] assembled 12,500 CARDINAL troops and attacked [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , South Carolina GPE , defeating General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] . By June DATE , they occupied the South Carolina GPE Piedmont.[172 ] [REDACTED] returned to New York GPE and left 8,000 CARDINAL troops under the command of General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] Congress ORG replaced Lincoln ORG with Horatio Gates ORG ; after his defeat in the Battle of Camden LOC , Gates ORG was replaced by [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , Washington GPE 's initial choice , but the British NORP had firm control of the South LOC . Washington GPE was reinvigorated , however , when [REDACTED] returned from France GPE with more ships , men , and supplies,[174 ] and 5,000 CARDINAL veteran French NORP troops led by Marshal Rochambeau ORG arrived at Newport GPE , Rhode Island GPE in July 1780.[175 DATE ] French NORP naval forces then landed , led by Admiral de Grasse.[176 ] ORG Washington GPE 's army went into winter quarters DATE at New Windsor GPE , New York GPE in December 1780 DATE ; he urged Congress ORG and state officials to expedite provisions so the army would not " continue to struggle under the same difficulties they have hitherto endured".[177 ] On March 1 , 1781 DATE , Congress ORG ratified the Articles of Confederation ORG , but the government that took effect on March 2 DATE did not have the power to levy taxes , and it loosely held the states [REDACTED] ]
General [REDACTED] sent [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , now a British NORP Brigadier General with 1,700 CARDINAL troops , to Virginia GPE to capture Portsmouth ORG and conduct raids on Patriot ORG forces ; Washington GPE responded by sending Lafayette ORG south to counter [REDACTED] 's efforts.[179 ] Washington GPE initially hoped to bring the fight to New York GPE , drawing off British NORP forces from Virginia GPE and ending the war there , but Rochambeau ORG advised him that [REDACTED] in Virginia GPE was the better target . De Grasse 's ORG fleet arrived off the Virginia GPE coast , cutting off British NORP retreat . Seeing the advantage , Washington GPE made a feint towards [REDACTED] in New York GPE , then headed south to Virginia.[180 ]
The siege of Yorktown GPE was a decisive victory by the combined forces of the Continental Army ORG commanded by Washington GPE , the French Army ORG commanded by General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , and the French NORP Navy ORG commanded by Admiral de Grasse ORG . On August 19 DATE , the march to [REDACTED] led by Washington GPE and Rochambeau ORG began , which is known now as the " celebrated march".[181 ] Washington GPE was in command of an army of 7,800 CARDINAL Frenchmen , 3,100 CARDINAL militia , and 8,000 CARDINAL Continentals . Inexperienced in siege warfare , he often deferred to the judgment of General [REDACTED] and relied on his advice . Despite this , Rochambeau ORG never challenged Washington GPE 's authority as the battle 's commanding officer.[182 ]
By late September DATE , Patriot - French ORG forces surrounded Yorktown GPE , trapped the British Army ORG , and prevented British NORP reinforcements from [REDACTED] in the North LOC , while the French NORP navy emerged victorious at the Battle of the Chesapeake LOC . The final American NORP offensive began with a shot fired by Washington.[183 ] The siege ended with a British NORP surrender on October 19 , 1781 DATE ; over 7,000 CARDINAL British NORP soldiers became prisoners of [REDACTED] ] Washington GPE negotiated the terms of surrender for two days DATE , and the official signing ceremony took place on October 19 DATE ; [REDACTED] claimed illness and was absent , sending General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] as his proxy . [ 185 CARDINAL ] As a gesture of goodwill , Washington GPE held a dinner for the American NORP , French NORP , and British NORP generals , all of whom fraternized on friendly terms and identified with one another as members of the same professional military [REDACTED] ]
Afterwards , Washington GPE moved the army to New Windsor GPE , New York GPE where they remained stationed until the Treaty of Paris ORG was signed on September 3 , 1783 DATE , formally ending the war . Although the peace treaty did not happen for two years DATE following the end of the battle , [REDACTED] proved to be the last significant battle or campaign of the Revolutionary War EVENT , with the British NORP Parliament agreeing to cease hostilities in March 1782.[187 DATE ]
When peace negotiations began in April 1782 DATE , both the British NORP and French NORP began gradually evacuating their forces.[188 PRODUCT ] With the American NORP treasury empty , unpaid and mutinous soldiers forced the adjournment of Congress ORG . In March 1783 DATE , Washington GPE successfully calmed the Newburgh Conspiracy LAW , a planned munity by American NORP officers ; Congress ORG promised each a five - year DATE [REDACTED] [REDACTED] Washington GPE submitted an account of $ 450,000 MONEY in expenses which he had advanced to the army , equivalent to $ 9.15 million MONEY in 2022 DATE . The account was settled , though it was allegedly vague about large sums and included expenses his wife had incurred through visits to his headquarters.[190 ]
The following month DATE , a Congressional NORP committee led by [REDACTED] [REDACTED] began adapting the army for peacetime . In August 1783 DATE , Washington GPE gave the Army ORG 's perspective to the committee in his Sentiments on a Peace Establishment WORK_OF_ART , which advised Congress ORG to keep a standing army , create a " national militia " of separate state units , and establish a navy and a national military [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] The Treaty of Paris WORK_OF_ART was signed on September 3 , 1783 DATE , and Britain GPE officially recognized American NORP independence . Washington GPE disbanded his army , giving a farewell address to his soldiers on November 2.[192 DATE ] During this time , Washington GPE oversaw the evacuation of British NORP forces in New York GPE and was greeted by parades and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] Along with Governor [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , he took formal possession of the city on November 25.[194 DATE ]
In early December 1783 DATE , Washington GPE bade farewell to his officers at Fraunces Tavern ORG and resigned as commander - in - chief soon thereafter.[195 ] In a final appearance in uniform , he gave a statement to the Congress ORG : " I consider it an indispensable duty to close this last solemn act of my official life , by commending the interests of our dearest country to the protection of Almighty God , and those who have the superintendence of them , to his holy keeping . "[ 196 CARDINAL ] Washington GPE 's resignation was acclaimed at home and abroad and showed a skeptical world that the new republic would not degenerate into chaos.[h][198 ]
The same month DATE , Washington GPE was appointed president - general of the Society of the Cincinnati ORG , a newly established hereditary fraternity of Revolutionary War EVENT officers . He served in this capacity for the remainder of his life.[i][200 ]
" I am not only retired from all public employments but I am retiring within myself , and shall be able to view the solitary walk and tread the paths of private life with heartfelt satisfaction ... I will move gently down the stream of life , until I sleep with my fathers . "
[REDACTED] [REDACTED] in a letter to Lafayette ORG . February 1 DATE , 1784.[201 CARDINAL ]
Washington GPE was longing to return home after spending just ten days DATE at Mount Vernon LOC out of 8 + 12 years DATE of war . He arrived on Christmas Eve DATE , delighted to be " free of the bustle of a camp and the busy scenes of public life".[202 ] He was a celebrity and was feted during a visit to his mother at Fredericksburg GPE in February 1784 DATE , and he received a constant stream of visitors wishing to pay their respects at Mount Vernon.[203 LOC ]
Washington GPE reactivated his interests in the Great Dismal Swamp FAC and Potomac NORP canal projects begun before the war , though neither paid him any dividends , and he undertook a 34 - day DATE , 680 - mile QUANTITY ( 1,090 km QUANTITY ) trip to check on his land holdings in the Ohio GPE Country.[204 ] He oversaw the completion of the remodeling work at Mount Vernon GPE , which transformed his residence into the mansion that survives to this day DATE although his financial situation was not strong . Creditors paid him in depreciated wartime currency , and he owed significant amounts in taxes and wages . Mount Vernon GPE had made no profit during his absence , and he saw persistently poor crop yields due to pestilence and poor weather . His estate recorded its eleventh year DATE running at a deficit in 1787 DATE , and there was little prospect of improvement.[205 ]
To make his estate profitable again , Washington GPE undertook a new landscaping plan and succeeded in cultivating a range of fast - growing trees and native shrubs.[206 ] He also began breeding mules after being gifted a Spanish NORP jack by [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] of Spain GPE in 1784 DATE . There were few mules in the United States GPE at that time , and he believed that they would revolutionize agriculture and transportation.[207 ]
Before returning to private life in June 1783 DATE , Washington GPE called for a strong union . Though he was concerned that he might be criticized for meddling in civil matters , he sent a circular letter to the states , maintaining that the Articles of Confederation ORG was no more than " a rope of sand " . He believed the nation was on the verge of " anarchy and confusion " , was vulnerable to foreign intervention , and that a national constitution would unify the states under a strong central government.[208 ]
When Shays ' Rebellion erupted in Massachusetts GPE over taxation , Washington GPE was further convinced that a national constitution was needed.[209 ] Some nationalists feared that the new republic had descended into lawlessness , and they met on September 11 , 1786 DATE , at Annapolis ORG to ask Congress ORG to revise the Articles of Confederation ORG . One CARDINAL of their biggest efforts was getting Washington GPE to attend.[210 ] Congress ORG agreed to a Constitutional Convention LAW to be held in Philadelphia GPE in Spring 1787 DATE , with each state to send delegates.[211 ]
On December 4 , 1786 DATE , Washington GPE was chosen to lead the Virginia GPE delegation , but he declined on December 21 DATE . He had concerns about the legality of the convention and consulted [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , and others . They persuaded him to attend as his presence might induce reluctant states to send delegates and smooth the way for the ratification process while also giving legitimacy to the convention.[212 ] On March 28 DATE , Washington GPE told Governor [REDACTED] [REDACTED] that he would attend the convention but made it clear that he was urged to attend.[213 ]
Washington GPE arrived in Philadelphia GPE on May 9 , 1787 DATE , though a quorum was not attained until May 25 DATE . [REDACTED] [REDACTED] nominated Washington GPE to preside over the convention , and he was unanimously elected to serve as president general.[214 ] The convention 's state - mandated purpose was to revise the Articles of Confederation ORG , and the new government would be established when the resulting document was " duly confirmed by the several states".[215 ] Randolph introduced [REDACTED] 's [REDACTED] [REDACTED] on May 27 DATE , the third day DATE of the convention . It called for an entirely new constitution and a sovereign national government , which Washington GPE highly recommended.[216 ]
On July 10 DATE , Washington GPE wrote to [REDACTED] [REDACTED] : " I almost despair of seeing a favorable issue to the proceedings of our convention and do therefore repent having had any agency in the business . "[ 217 CARDINAL ] Nevertheless , he lent his prestige to the work of the other delegates , unsuccessfully lobbying many to support ratification of the Constitution LAW , such as anti - federalists [REDACTED] [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] ] The final version was voted on and signed by 39 CARDINAL of 55 CARDINAL delegates on September 17 , 1787 DATE .
In 1788 DATE , the Board of Visitors ORG of the College of William & Mary ORG decided to re - establish the position of Chancellor , and elected Washington GPE to the office on January 18.[219 DATE ] The College Rector ORG [REDACTED] [REDACTED] wrote to Washington GPE inviting him to the post , and in a letter dated April 30 , 1788 DATE , Washington GPE accepted the position of the 14th ORDINAL Chancellor of the College of William & Mary.[220 ORG ] He continued to serve through his presidency until his death on December 14 DATE , 1799.[219 CARDINAL ]
The delegates to the Convention ORG anticipated a Washington GPE presidency and left it to him to define the office once elected.[j][217 ]
The state electors under the Constitution LAW voted for the president on February 4 , 1789 DATE , and Washington GPE suspected that most republicans NORP had not voted for him.[222 ] The mandated March 4 DATE date passed without a Congressional NORP quorum to count the votes , but a quorum was reached on April 5 DATE . The votes were tallied the next day DATE , and Washington GPE won the majority of every state 's electoral votes . He was informed of his election as president by Congressional NORP Secretary [REDACTED] Thomson.[223 ] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] received the next highest number of votes and was elected vice president.[224 ] Despite feeling " anxious and painful sensations " about leaving Mount Vernon LOC , he departed for New York City GPE on April 16 DATE to be inaugurated.[225][226 ]
Washington GPE was inaugurated on April 30 , 1789 DATE , taking the oath of office at Federal Hall ORG in New York GPE City.[k][228 ] His coach was led by militia and a marching band and followed by statesmen and foreign dignitaries in an inaugural parade , with a crowd of 10,000.[229 CARDINAL ] Chancellor [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] administered the oath , using a Bible WORK_OF_ART provided by the Masons , after which the militia fired a 13 CARDINAL - gun salute.[230 ] Washington GPE read a speech in the Senate Chamber ORG , asking " that Almighty Being ... consecrate the liberties and happiness of the people of the United ORG States".[231 ] Though he wished to serve without a salary , Congress ORG insisted that he accept it , later providing Washington GPE $ 25,000 MONEY per year to defray costs of the presidency , equivalent to $ 6.14 million MONEY today.[232 ]
Washington GPE wrote to [REDACTED] [REDACTED] : " As the first ORDINAL of everything in our situation will serve to establish a precedent , it is devoutly wished on my part that these precedents be fixed on true principles . "[ 233 CARDINAL ] To that end , he preferred the title " Mr. President " over more majestic names proposed by the Senate ORG , including " His Excellency " and " His Highness the President".[234 ] WORK_OF_ART His executive precedents included the inaugural address , messages to Congress ORG , and the cabinet form of the executive branch.[235 ]
Washington GPE planned to resign after his first ORDINAL term , but political strife convinced him to remain in office.[236 ] He was an able administrator and a judge of talent and character , and he regularly talked with department heads to get their advice.[237 ] He tolerated opposing views , despite fears that a democratic system would lead to political violence , and he conducted a smooth transition of power to his successor.[238 ] He remained non - partisan throughout his presidency and opposed the divisiveness of political parties , but he favored a strong central government , was sympathetic to a Federalist NORP form of government , and leery of the Republican NORP opposition.[239 ]
Washington GPE dealt with major problems . The old Confederation ORG lacked the powers to handle its workload and had weak leadership , no executive , a small bureaucracy of clerks , large debt , worthless paper money , and no power to establish taxes.[240 ] He had the task of assembling an executive department and relied on [REDACTED] [REDACTED] for advice selecting its officers.[241 ] Britain GPE refused to relinquish its forts in the American NORP West,[240 ] and [REDACTED] pirates preyed on American NORP merchant ships in the Mediterranean LOC before the United States GPE even had a navy.[242 NORP ]
Congress ORG created executive departments in 1789 DATE , including the State Department ORG in July DATE , the War Department ORG in August DATE , and the Treasury Department ORG in September DATE . Washington GPE appointed [REDACTED] [REDACTED] as Attorney General , [REDACTED] [REDACTED] as Postmaster General , [REDACTED] [REDACTED] as Secretary of State ORG , [REDACTED] [REDACTED] as Secretary of War , and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] as Secretary of the Treasury ORG . Washington GPE 's cabinet became a consulting and advisory body , not mandated by the Constitution.[243 ] FAC Washington GPE 's cabinet members formed rival parties with sharply opposing views , most fiercely illustrated between [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] Washington GPE restricted cabinet discussions to topics of his choosing , without participating in the debate . He occasionally requested cabinet opinions in writing and expected department heads to agreeably carry out his decisions.[240 ]
Washington GPE was apolitical and opposed the formation of parties , suspecting that conflict would undermine republicanism.[245 ] He exercised great restraint in using his veto power , writing that " I give my Signature to many Bills GPE with which my Judgment PRODUCT is at variance ... "[ 246 CARDINAL ]
His closest advisors formed two CARDINAL factions , portending the First Party System ORG . Secretary of the Treasury ORG [REDACTED] [REDACTED] formed the Federalist Party ORG to promote national credit and a financially powerful nation . Secretary of State ORG [REDACTED] [REDACTED] opposed [REDACTED] 's agenda and founded the Jeffersonian NORP Republicans NORP . Washington GPE favored [REDACTED] 's agenda , however , and it ultimately went into effect resulting in bitter controversy.[247 ]
Washington GPE proclaimed November 26 , 1789 DATE , as a day of DATE Thanksgiving DATE to encourage national unity . " It is the duty of all nations to acknowledge the providence of Almighty God , to obey His will , to be grateful for His benefits , and humbly to implore His protection and favor . " He spent that day DATE fasting and visiting debtors in prison to provide them with food and beer.[248 ]
In response to two CARDINAL antislavery petitions that were presented to Congress ORG in 1790 DATE , slaveholders in Georgia GPE and South Carolina GPE threatened to " blow the trumpet of civil war " . Washington ORG and Congress ORG responded with a series of racist measures : naturalization was denied to black immigrants ; blacks were barred from serving in state militias ; the Southwest Territory ORG ( later the state of Tennessee GPE ) was permitted to maintain slavery ; and two CARDINAL more slave states were admitted ( Kentucky GPE in 1792 DATE and Tennessee GPE in 1796 DATE ) . On February 12 , 1793 DATE , Washington GPE signed into law the Fugitive Slave Act LAW , which overrode state laws and courts , allowing agents to cross state lines to return escaped slaves.[249 ] Many free blacks in the north decried the law believing it would allow bounty hunting and kidnapping . The Fugitive Slave Act LAW gave effect to the Constitution 's Fugitive Slave Clause LAW , and the Act was passed overwhelmingly in Congress.[250 ]
At the same time , Washington GPE signed a reenactment of the Northwest Ordinance GPE in 1789 DATE , which had freed all slaves brought after 1787 DATE into a vast expanse of federal territory north of the Ohio River LOC , except for slaves escaping from slave states.[251][252 CARDINAL ] The 1787 DATE law lapsed when the new U.S. Constitution was ratified in 1789.[253 CARDINAL ] He also signed the Slave Trade Act of 1794 LAW , which sharply limited American NORP involvement in the Atlantic LOC slave trade.[254 ] On February 18 , 1791 DATE , Congress ORG admitted the free state of Vermont GPE into the Union as the 14th ORDINAL state as of March 4 DATE , 1791.[255 ]
Washington GPE 's first ORDINAL term was largely devoted to economic concerns.[256 ] Establishment of public credit became a primary challenge for the federal [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] submitted a report to a deadlocked Congress ORG , and he , [REDACTED] , and [REDACTED] reached the Compromise of 1790 DATE in which Jefferson ORG agreed to [REDACTED] 's debt proposals in exchange for moving the nation 's capital temporarily to Philadelphia GPE and then south near Georgetown GPE on the Potomac NORP River.[247 ] The terms were legislated in the Funding Act LAW of 1790 DATE and the Residence Act LAW , both of which Washington GPE signed into law . Congress ORG authorized the assumption and payment of the nation 's debts , with funding provided by customs duties and excise taxes.[258 ]
[REDACTED] caused controversy in Cabinet ORG by advocating for the establishment of the First Bank of the United States ORG . [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] objected to the idea , but legislation creating the bank easily passed Congress ORG . [REDACTED] and Randolph ORG insisted the federal government was going beyond its constitutional authority . [REDACTED] argued the government could charter the bank under the implied powers granted by the constitution . Washington GPE sided with [REDACTED] and signed the bank legislation on February 25 , 1791 DATE . The rift between [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] , meanwhile , became openly hostile.[259 ]
The nation 's first ORDINAL financial crisis occurred in March 1792 DATE . [REDACTED] 's Federalists exploited large loans to gain control of U.S. GPE debt securities , causing a run on the national bank;[260 ] the markets returned to normal by mid - April.[261 ] [REDACTED] believed [REDACTED] was part of the scheme , despite [REDACTED] 's efforts to ameliorate.[262 ] PERSON [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] adopted diametrically opposed political principles . [REDACTED] believed in a strong national government requiring a national bank and foreign loans to function , while [REDACTED] believed the states and the farm element should primarily direct the government ; he also resented the idea of banks and foreign loans . To Washington GPE 's dismay , the two CARDINAL men persistently entered into disputes and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] demanded that [REDACTED] resign if he could not support Washington GPE , and [REDACTED] told Washington GPE that [REDACTED] 's fiscal system would lead to the overthrow of the republic.[264 ] Washington GPE urged them to call a truce for the sake of the nation , but they ignored him.[265 ]
[REDACTED] 's political actions , his support of Freneau 's ORG National Gazette,[266 ] and his attempts to undermine [REDACTED] nearly led Washington GPE to dismiss him from the cabinet ; he ultimately resigned his position in December 1793 DATE , and Washington GPE forsook him.[267 ]
The feud led to the well - defined Federalist NORP and Republican NORP parties , and party affiliation became necessary for election to Congress ORG by 1794.[268 CARDINAL ] Washington GPE remained aloof from congressional attacks on [REDACTED] , but did not publicly protect him . The [REDACTED] Reynolds ORG sex scandal opened [REDACTED] to disgrace , but Washington GPE continued to hold him in " very high esteem".[269 ]
In March 1791 DATE , at [REDACTED] 's urging , with support from [REDACTED] , Congress ORG imposed an excise tax on distilled spirits to help curtail the national debt , which took effect in July.[270 ] Grain farmers strongly protested in Pennsylvania GPE 's frontier districts ; they argued that they were unrepresented and were shouldering too much of the debt , comparing their situation to British NORP taxation pre - Revolution EVENT .
On August 2 DATE , Washington GPE assembled his cabinet to discuss the situation . Unlike Washington GPE , who had reservations about using force , [REDACTED] was eager to suppress the rebellion with federal authority.[271 ] Wanting to avoid involving the federal government , Washington GPE first ORDINAL called on Pennsylvania GPE state officials to take the initiative , but they declined . On August 7 DATE , Washington GPE issued his first ORDINAL proclamation for calling up state militias . After appealing for peace , he reminded the protestors that , unlike the rule of the British NORP crown , the Federal law was issued by state - elected representatives.[272 ]
Threats and violence against tax collectors , however , escalated into defiance against federal authority in 1794 DATE and gave rise to the Whiskey Rebellion ORG . Washington GPE issued a final proclamation on September 25 DATE , threatening the use of military force to no avail.[272 ] The federal army was not up to the task , so Washington GPE invoked the Militia Act LAW of 1792 DATE to summon state militias.[273 ] Governors sent troops , initially commanded by Washington GPE , who handed over command to [REDACTED] [REDACTED] to lead them into the rebellious districts . They took 150 CARDINAL prisoners , and the remaining rebels dispersed . Two CARDINAL of the prisoners were condemned to death , but Washington GPE exercised his Constitutional authority for the first ORDINAL time and pardoned them.[274 ]
Washington GPE 's forceful action demonstrated that the new government could protect itself and its tax collectors . This represented the first ORDINAL use of federal military force against the states and citizens.[275 ] Washington GPE justified his action against " certain self - created societies " , which he regarded as " subversive organizations " that threatened the national union . He did not dispute their right to protest , but he insisted that their dissent must not violate federal law . Congress ORG agreed and extended their congratulations to him ; only [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] expressed indifference.[276 ]
In April 1792 DATE , the French Revolutionary Wars ORG began between Britain GPE and France GPE , and Washington GPE declared America GPE 's neutrality . The revolutionary government of France GPE sent diplomat [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] Genet to America GPE , and he was welcomed with great enthusiasm . He created a network of new Democratic NORP - Republican Societies promoting France GPE 's interests , but Washington GPE denounced them and demanded that the French NORP recall Genet.[277 ] The National Assembly of France ORG granted Washington GPE honorary French NORP citizenship on August 26 , 1792 DATE , during the early stages of the French NORP Revolution.[278 ]
[REDACTED] formulated the Jay Treaty LAW to normalize trade relations with Britain GPE while removing them from western forts , and also to resolve financial debts remaining from the Revolution.[279 ] Chief Justice [REDACTED] [REDACTED] acted as Washington GPE 's negotiator and signed the treaty on November 19 , 1794 DATE ; critical [REDACTED] , however , supported France GPE . Washington GPE deliberated , then supported the treaty because it avoided war with Britain,[280 ] but was disappointed that its provisions favored Britain.[281 ] He mobilized public opinion and secured ratification in the [REDACTED] ] but faced frequent public criticism.[283 ]
The British NORP agreed to abandon their forts around the Great Lakes FAC , and the United States GPE modified the boundary with Canada GPE . The government liquidated numerous pre - Revolution EVENT debts , and the British NORP opened the British West Indies ORG to American NORP trade . The treaty secured peace with Britain GPE and a decade DATE of prosperous trade . [REDACTED] claimed that it angered France GPE and " invited rather than avoided " war.[284 ] Relations with France GPE deteriorated afterward and , two days DATE before Washington GPE 's term ended , the French Directory ORG declared the authority to seize American NORP ships,[285 ] leaving succeeding president [REDACTED] [REDACTED] with prospective war.[286 ]
[REDACTED] [REDACTED] describes Washington GPE as always trying to be even - handed in dealing with the Natives ORG . He states that Washington GPE hoped they would abandon their itinerant hunting life and adapt to fixed agricultural communities in the manner of white settlers . He also maintains that Washington GPE never advocated outright confiscation of tribal land or the forcible removal of tribes and that he berated American NORP settlers who abused natives , admitting that he held out no hope for peaceful relations as long as " frontier settlers entertain the opinion that there is not the same crime ( or indeed no crime at all ) in killing a native as in killing a white man . "[ 287 CARDINAL ]
By contrast , [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] wrote that , " Washington GPE had a lifelong obsession with getting Indian NORP land , either for himself or for his nation , and initiated policies and campaigns that had devastating effects in Indian NORP country . "[288 ] He stated :
The growth of the nation demanded the dispossession of Indian NORP people . Washington GPE hoped the process could be bloodless and that Indian NORP people would give up their lands for a " fair " price and move away . But if Indians NORP refused and resisted , as they often did , he felt he had no choice but to " extirpate " them and that the expeditions he sent to destroy Indian NORP towns were therefore entirely justified.[289]During the fall of 1789 DATE , Washington GPE had to contend with the British NORP refusing to evacuate their forts in the Northwest ORG frontier and their concerted efforts to incite Indian NORP tribes to attack American NORP settlers.[290 ] The Northwest ORG tribes under Miami GPE chief [REDACTED] [REDACTED] allied with the British NORP to resist American NORP expansion , and killed 1,500 CARDINAL settlers between 1783 DATE and 1790.[291 CARDINAL ]
Washington GPE declared that " the Government of the United States WORK_OF_ART are determined that their Administration of Indian Affairs shall be directed entirely by the great principles of Justice ORG and humanity " , and provided that treaties should negotiate their land interests.[292 ] The administration regarded powerful tribes as foreign nations , and Washington GPE even smoked a peace pipe and drank wine with them at the President 's House ORG in Philadelphia.[293 ] He made numerous attempts to conciliate them;[294 ] he equated killing indigenous peoples with killing whites and sought to integrate them into European American NORP culture.[295 ]
In the Southwest LOC , negotiations failed between federal commissioners and raiding Indian NORP tribes seeking retribution . Washington GPE invited Creek Chief [REDACTED] [REDACTED] and 24 CARDINAL leading chiefs to New York GPE to negotiate a treaty and treated them like foreign dignitaries . [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] concluded the Treaty of New York LAW on August 7 , 1790 DATE , which provided the tribes with agricultural supplies and [REDACTED] with the rank of Brigadier General ORG and an annual salary of $ 1,200 MONEY , equivalent to $ 28,404 MONEY in 2022.[296 CARDINAL ]
In 1790 DATE , Washington GPE sent Brigadier General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] to pacify the Northwest ORG tribes , but [REDACTED] [REDACTED] routed him twice and forced him to withdraw.[297 ] The Northwestern Confederacy of WORK_OF_ART tribes used guerrilla tactics and were an effective force against the sparsely manned American Army ORG . Washington GPE sent Major General [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] from Fort Washington FAC on an expedition to restore peace in the territory in 1791 DATE . On November 4 DATE , St. Clair 's ORG forces were ambushed and soundly defeated by tribal forces with few survivors.[298 ]
Washington GPE replaced the disgraced St. Clair ORG with the Revolutionary War EVENT hero [REDACTED] [REDACTED] . From 1792 to 1793 , [REDACTED] instructed his troops on Native American NORP warfare tactics and instilled discipline which was lacking under St. Clair.[299 ] In August 1794 DATE , Washington GPE sent [REDACTED] into tribal territory with authority to drive them out by burning their villages and crops in the Maumee Valley.[300 ] On August 24 DATE , the American NORP army defeated the Northwestern Confederacy ORG at the Battle of Fallen Timbers FAC , and the Treaty of Greenville PRODUCT in August 1795 DATE opened two - thirds CARDINAL of the Ohio Country ORG for American settlement.[301 ]
Washington GPE initially planned to retire after his first ORDINAL term , weary of office and in poor health . After dealing with the infighting in his own cabinet and with partisan critics , he showed little enthusiasm for a second ORDINAL term , while [REDACTED] also wanted him not to run.[302 ORG ] Washington GPE 's nephew [REDACTED] [REDACTED] Washington GPE , managing Mount Vernon LOC in his absence , was critically ill , further increasing Washington GPE 's desire to retire.[303 ]
Many , however , urged him to run for a second ORDINAL term . [REDACTED] told him that his absence would only allow the dangerous political rift in his cabinet and the House ORG to worsen . [REDACTED] also pleaded with him not to retire , agreeing to drop his attacks on [REDACTED] , and stating that he would also retire if Washington GPE did.[304 ] [REDACTED] maintained that Washington GPE 's absence would be " deplored as the greatest evil " to the country.[305 ] With the election of 1792 DATE nearing , Washington GPE relented and agreed to run.[295 ]
On February 13 , 1793 DATE , the Electoral College ORG unanimously re - elected Washington GPE president , and [REDACTED] [REDACTED] as vice president by a vote of 77 to 50.[295 CARDINAL ] He was sworn into office by Associate Justice William Cushing ORG on March 4 , 1793 DATE , in the Senate Chamber of Congress Hall ORG in Philadelphia GPE . Afterwards , Washington GPE gave a brief address before immediately retiring to the President 's House.[306 ]
On April 22 , 1793 DATE , when the French NORP Revolutionary Wars broke out , Washington GPE issued a proclamation which declared American NORP neutrality . He was resolved to pursue " a conduct friendly and impartial toward the belligerent Powers ORG " while also warning Americans NORP not to intervene in the conflict.[307 ] Although Washington GPE recognized France GPE 's revolutionary government , he would eventually ask French NORP minister to the United States GPE [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] Genet be recalled over the Citizen Genet affair.[308 ] Genet was a diplomatic troublemaker who was openly hostile toward Washington GPE 's neutrality policy . He procured four CARDINAL American NORP ships as privateers to strike at Spanish NORP forces ( British NORP allies ) in Florida GPE while organizing militias to strike at other British NORP possessions . However , his efforts failed to draw the United States GPE into the conflict.[309 ]
On July 31 , 1793 DATE , [REDACTED] submitted his resignation from [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] , desiring more income for his family , resigned from office in January 1795 DATE and was replaced by [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] .. While his relationship with Washington GPE would remain friendly , Washington GPE 's relationship with his Secretary of War [REDACTED] [REDACTED] deteriorated after rumors that Knox ORG had profited from contracts for the construction of U.S. GPE frigates which had been commissioned under the Naval Act of 1794 LAW in order to combat [REDACTED] pirates , forcing [REDACTED] to resign.[311][312 ]
In the final months DATE of his presidency , Washington GPE was assailed by his political foes and a partisan press who accused him of being ambitious and greedy . He came to regard the press as a disuniting , " diabolical " force of falsehoods.[313 ] At the end of his second ORDINAL term , Washington GPE retired for personal and political reasons , dismayed with personal attacks , and to ensure that a truly contested presidential election could be held . He did not feel bound to a two CARDINAL - term limit , but his retirement set a significant precedent.[314 ]
